passage.title: A shopping trip
passage.paragraph: One morning Mr. and Mrs. Green drive their car and go shopping. In the shop they see a lot of clothes. Mrs. Green likes them. So she buys a shirt for their son, a skirt for their daughter, and a sweater for Mr. Green. She buys a blouse for herself, too.
At about twelve o'clock, they go home, but they lose their way. Mr. Green drivers over to an old man and asks, "Where am I?"
"You're in your car, sir." The old man answers.
